an5.85:1: "Bhikkhus, possessing five qualities, an elder bhikkhu is displeasing and disagreeable to his fellow monks and is neither respected nor esteemed by them. What five? He cannot patiently endure forms, sounds, odours, tastes, and tactile objects.Possessing these five qualities … nor esteemed by them.
an5.85:2: "Bhikkhus, possessing five (other) qualities, an elder bhikkhu is pleasing and agreeable to his fellow monks and is respected and esteemed by them. What five? He can patiently endure forms, sounds, odours, tastes, and tactile objects. Possessing these five qualities … and esteemed by them."
